Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council (HRC) -- Amend HRC - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Charter Amendment)
(Inspector General)

Summary:  The following proposition would amend the Jefferson Parish Charter, effective January 1, 2012 to establish the office of inspector general and an ethics and compliance commission and to provide authority to investigate any person in the service of the Parish for lack of qualifications, incompetence, neglect of duty, failure to comply with a lawful directive or gross misconduct in reference to that person's duties.
Race.FullText: Shall the Jefferson Parish Charter be amended to establish the office of inspector general and an ethics and compliance commission and to provide authority to investigate any person in the service of the Parish, by amending sections 2.01(A)(4), 4.01(B), and 4.03(A) and (B), and by adding Section 2.01(A)(10), Section 4.09, 4.10 and 4.11 of the Jefferson Parish Charter to read as stated in Sections 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 of Jefferson Parish Council Ordinance No. 23989, adopted on April 6, 2011 and subject to the approval of the tax by the electorate of the Jefferson Parish Inspector General Special Services Funding District of the Parish of Jefferson, State of Louisiana at the October 22, 2011 election?

Race.SpecificTitle: Esprit Stoneb.Neigh.Imp.Dist. -- Parcel Fee - Parish Council
Race.SummaryText:
Esprit at Stonebridge Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  Authorization for Esprit at Stonebridge Neighborhood Improvement District, Jefferson Parish, State of Louisiana (the "District") to levy an annual flat fee beginning in the year 2012 against each parcel of improved immovable property listed and/or assessed on the tax rolls of the Parish of Jefferson and located in the District to be used for the purpose of purchasing, acquiring, constructing and improving, or leasing, maintaining and operating machinery and equipment and other facilities to be used, and paying other expenses incurred and/or contracting for services to be rendered in connection with providing security enhancement services for the District. The estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the flat parcel fee is estimated to be $13,500 during its first year of collection.
Race.FullText: Shall Esprit at Stonebridge Neighborhood Improvement District, Parish of Jefferson, State of Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to levy and collect an annual parcel fee, beginning in the year 2012, in the amount of $100 in each of the years 2012 to 2014, inclusive, against each parcel of improved immovable property listed and/or assessed on the tax rolls of the Parish of Jefferson and located in the District, with the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee during the first year of collection of $13,500, for the purpose of purchasing, acquiring, constructing and improving, or leasing, maintaining and operating machinery and equipment and other facilities to be used, and paying other expenses incurred and/or contracting for services to be rendered in connection with providing security enhancement services for the District?

Race.SummaryText:
Inspector General Special Services Funding District Proposition
(Unincorporated Jefferson Parish)

Summary:  Authority to levy and collect one-half (1/2) mill property tax for 10 years, beginning in 2012 and ending with the year 2021 to provide, maintain, administer and operate an office of inspector general and an ethics and compliance commission in the Parish, the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax from one year's levy being $1,264,094.
Race.FullText: Shall the Jefferson Parish Inspector General Special Services Funding District of the Parish of Jefferson, State of Louisiana (the "District") be authorized to levy and collect a special tax of not to exceed one-half (1/2) mill on all property subject to taxation in the Parish, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, to be annually levied, with collections from the levy of the tax estimated to be $1,264,094 for one entire year, and dedicated to the following public purposes:  to be deposited in and credited to the Inspector General & Ethics Fund and used to provide, maintain, administer and operate an office of inspector general and an ethics and compliance commission in the Parish; subject to Ordinance No. 24010 adopted by the Parish Council reducing certain existing approved millages in an aggregate amount equal to the proposed millage to be approved at the October 22, 2011 election?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Gretna (Fire Prot.) -- 2.00 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Gretna Proposition
(Fire Protection)

Summary:  Ten years, two (2.00) mills property tax renewal for the object and purpose of fire protection in the pre-Timberlane annexation area of the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, that being the same area contained wholly within voting Precincts G-1 through G-11, but excluding the area included in voting Precincts G-12 and G-13 (the annexed area).
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew the levy of a special tax of two (2.00) mills on all property subject to taxation in the Pre-Timberlane Annexation area of the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, that being the same area contained wholly within voting precincts G-1 through G-11, but excluding the area included in voting precincts G-12 and G-13 (the annexed area), (an estimated $240,312.28 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, both inclusive for the object and purpose of fire protection in the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, a work of permanent public improvement, title to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Gretna (Police Prot.) -- 7.00 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Gretna Proposition
(Police Protection)

Summary:  To renew a special tax of seven (7.00) mills on all property subject to taxation in precincts G-1 through G-11 in the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, and establish a new tax on all property subject to taxation in the newly annexed portion of the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana consisting of precincts G-12 and G-13 all for a period of ten (10) years and all for the object and purpose of police protection in the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, that being the same area contained wholly within voting Precincts G-1 through G-13.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana (the "City"), renew a special tax of seven (7.00) mills on all property subject to taxation in precincts G-1 through G-11 in the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, and establish a new tax on all property subject to taxation in the newly annexed portion of the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, consisting of precincts G-12 and G-13 (an estimated $952,482.38 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), all for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, both inclusive for the object and purpose of police protection in the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, a work of permanent public improvement, title to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Gretna (Rec. & Soc. Serv.) -- 2.6 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Gretna Proposition
(Recreational and Social Services)

Summary:  To renew the levy of a special tax of two and six tenths (2.6) mills on all property subject to taxation in precincts G-1 through G-11 in the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, and establish a new tax of 2.6 mills on all property subject to taxation in the newly annexed portion of the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana consisting of precincts G-12 and G-13 all for a period of ten (10) years and all for the object and purpose of supplementing Recreational Services by two and one tenth (2.1) mills and Social Services to the Aged by one-half (.5) mills in the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, that being the same area contained wholly within voting Precincts G-1 through G-13.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, renew a special tax of two and six tenths (2.6) mills on all property subject to taxation in precincts G-1 through G-11 in the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, and establish a new tax of 2.6 mills on all property subject to taxation in the newly annexed portion of the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, consisting of precincts G-12 and G-13, (all for an estimated $353,779.17 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), all for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, both inclusive for the object and purpose of supplementing Recreational Services by two and one tenth (2.1) mills and Social Services to the Aged by one-half (.5) mills in the City of Gretna, State of Louisiana, that being the same area contained wholly within voting Precincts G-1 through G-13 a work of permanent public improvement, title to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Westwego (Fire Prot.) -- 4.28 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Westwego Proposition
(Fire Protection)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy and collect 4.28 mills property tax for 10 years, beginning in 2012 in the City of Westwego for maintaining and operating the fire protection district for the City of Westwego; the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one year is $219,441.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Westwego, Parish of Jefferson, State of Louisiana, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of 4.28 mills on all property subject to taxation in said City for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2012, for the purpose of maintaining and operating a fire protection district within said City, including the acquisition of the necessary equipment and facilities therefor, titles to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Westwego (Parks) -- 2.56 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Westwego Proposition
(Parks)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy and collect 2.56 mills property tax for 10 years, beginning in 2012 in the City of Westwego for maintaining and lighting the parks for the City of Westwego; the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one year is $131,255.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Westwego, Parish of Jefferson, State of Louisiana, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of 2.56 mills on all property subject to taxation in said City for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2012, for the purpose of maintaining and lighting the parks within said City, including the acquisition of the necessary equipment and facilities therefor, titles to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Westwego (Police Dept) -- 4.28 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Westwego Proposition
(Police Department)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy and collect 4.28 mills property tax for 10 years, beginning in 2012 in the City of Westwego for maintaining and operating the police department for the City of Westwego; the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one year is $219,441.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Westwego, Parish of Jefferson, State of Louisiana, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of 4.28 mills on all property subject to taxation in said City for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2012, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the police department within said City, including the acquisition of the necessary equipment and facilities therefor, titles to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Westwego (Street Light) -- 2.56 Mills - Mayor & CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Westwego Proposition
(Street Lighting and Maintenance)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy and collect 2.56 mills property tax for 10 years, beginning in 2012 in the City of Westwego for maintaining and upgrading the street lighting and to expand the purpose of this tax to include street maintenance for the City of Westwego; the estimated amount reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the tax for one year is $131,255.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Westwego, Parish of Jefferson, State of Louisiana, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of 2.56 mills on all property subject to taxation in said City for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2012, for the purpose of maintaining and upgrading the street lighting and street maintenance within said City, including the acquisition of the necessary equipment and facilities therefor, titles to which shall be in the public?
